sub_topic: Calculating the electronegativity difference between two atoms
message_1: What is the electronegativity difference between a nitrogen atom (EN = 3.04) and an oxygen atom (EN = 3.44)?
message_2:
The electronegativity difference between a nitrogen atom (EN = 3.04) and an oxygen atom (EN = 3.44) can be calculated by subtracting the electronegativity of nitrogen from that of oxygen:

Electronegativity difference = EN(Oxygen) - EN(Nitrogen)
Electronegativity difference = 3.44 - 3.04
Electronegativity difference = 0.40

So, the electronegativity difference between nitrogen and oxygen is 0.40.
